post.title: PRISM Project‚Äôs Rita Kamishiro Held Successful Fundraiser for Mental Health Awareness Month
post.content:
Rita Kamishiro of PRISM Project has successfully raised US$10,000 during her charity stream last May 15 for the United States-based National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI). The charity stream held in support of Mental Health Awareness Month brings together other virtual personalities such as Ying, Meru Matsuro, and Phase Connect‚Äôs Pipkin Pippa to discuss their personal experiences and the tips they had learned on their own mental health journey.

During the charity stream, all of the donation goals have been unlocked by the community. The accomplished goals lead to the next set of events for the PRISM agent, such as ‚Äútrying to run a 5K while eating ghost peppers,‚Äù playing Minesweeper in VR, and doing a themed ‚Äúanime character workout.‚Äù

I'm really so grateful for you all. Despite my scuff and rambling and scatterbrained-ness, I'm really glad we were able to raise so much for a good cause. This really means a lot to me, and I hope you all feel the impact we've made.

Together, we're strong üíô

— Kamishiro Rita / Á•û‰ª£„Çä„Åü @ PRISM Project (@RitaKamishiro) May 15, 2022

Mental health is a topic Rita is passionate about, and she is happier to be able to bring awareness about it through her platform. Following the stream, she thanked her fans for raising so much for a good cause.

NAMI is the largest grassroots mental health organization in the US dedicated to helping people affected by mental illness. As NAMI amplifies its message, ‚ÄúTogether for Mental Health,‚Äù it continues to help build better lives through advocacy, education, support and public awareness.

Youth.gov notes that the National Mental Health Month was established in 1949 to increase awareness of the importance of mental health and wellness in Americans‚Äô lives, as well as to celebrate recovery from mental illness.

As a PRISM agent, Rita Kamishiro plays a variety of games and hosts her RKNGL radio show on stream. Rita actively shares her journey to become an idol on a weekly basis to her 24,000-strong YouTube subscriber-base. Watch the 4-hour Charity Stream in full on Rita Kamishiro‚Äôs YouTube channel.

Source: PRISM Project ¬∑ First posted on Anime Corner May 21, 2022

post.description: Fundraiser for mental illness reached US$15,000
